thread.title: Footage of Monaco star Kylian Mbappe as youngster proves why he was always destined for glory
thread.title_full: Footage of Monaco star Kylian Mbappe as youngster proves why he was always destined for glory

author: Thomas Bristow
title: Footage of Monaco star Kylian Mbappe as youngster proves why he was always destined for glory
text:
Sport Footage of Monaco star Kylian Mbappe as youngster proves why he was always destined for glory The Arsenal target has established himself as one of the biggest rising stars in Europe - and proved it against Manchester City Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Monaco hero Mbappe shows his class for youth side AS Bondy Share this video Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Prior to this season, not many people had heard of Monaco's Kylian Mbappe. Now, the 18-year-old has become one of Europe's most sought after targets. 
The pacy forward has scored 17 goals in 31 appearances this term, and played a huge hand in knocking Manchester City out of the Champions League. 
The Frenchman has even attracted the interest of Arsene Wenger and Arsenal. 
No doubt Monaco will do all they can to hold on to the youngster, or at least ramp up his transfer value like they did with Anthony Martial. Kylian Mbappe celebrates scoring against City (Photo: Getty Images) 
Recently, footage has emerged of Mbappe as a kid - and it's easy to see why he's become the player he is today. 
Even under the age of 10, playing for youth side AS Bondy, Mbappe demonstrated agility, strength and pace as he glided past opposition players. Kylian Mbappe has been on fire this season (Photo: REUTERS) 
The footage also demonstrates the forward's keen eye for goal back then, even from set-peices. 
No doubt Mbappe's name will dominate this summer's headlines as clubs from all over Europe will battle it out for the star's signing. poll loading Will Kylian Mbappe ever play in the Premier League? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
